thread.title: Ethiopia to host first Africa Airport Infrastructure MeetTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Ethiopia to host first Africa Airport Infrastructure MeetTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Ethiopia to host first Africa Airport Infrastructure Meet Published
The first Africa Airport Infrastructure and Aircraft Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) conference will be held in Addis Ababa, South Africa from Sept 22 to 24 at the United Nation Economic Commission for Africa (UN- ECA).
The AIMA-Africa Conference is Organized by BCI Aerospace, an international business convention organizer, and co-supported by Ethiopian Airlines, Ethiopiaâ€™s Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Pan African Chamber of Commerce and Industry and the African Airlines Association, among others.
Some 400 participants representing 250 companies from 30 countries are expected to attend AIMA Africa 2015, according to media reports.
The conference is also expected to play a crucial role in promoting the growth of airport infrastructure and bring growth in the sector.
The convention is the only event dedicated to airport infrastructure and aviation MRO in Africa and is expected to help Ethiopia share experiences with other countries in airport infrastructure construction and maintenance.
